defs: a woman with proper respect for herself.
a woman who loves intensely.
(one's respect) to be lost.
to lose one's self-respect or esteem; to be humiliated.

the act of practising.

a study - a) the act or process of applying the mind so as to acquire knowledge or understanding, as by reading, investigating, etc.; b) careful attention to, and critical examination and investigation of, any subject, event, etc.
the act, process or work of revising; revision.
the state of being or that which is, very close; vicinity; neighbourhood.
problem or group of written examples, passages, etc. to be studied and worked out for developing technical skill, as in mathematics, grammar, etc.

ಅಭ್ಯಾಸವಾಗು abhyāsavāgu to become habituated; to become accustomed; to become a regular habit; ಅಭ್ಯಾಸವಿಲ್ಲದ ಬ್ರಾಹ್ಮಣ ಅಗ್ನಿಹೋತ್ರಮಾಡಲಿಕ್ಕೆ ಹೋಗಿ ಗಡ್ಡ ಮೀಸೆ ಸುಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡ abhyāsavillada Brāhmaṇa agnihōtra mādalikke hōgi gaḍḍa mīse suṭṭu koṇḍa (prov.) (proverbial simile) a landing in disaster while attempting something without having necessary knowledge or experience.
(dial.) the state, fact or quality of resembling; similarity of appearance; resemblance.
the attachment, closeness (between two persons).
the feeling of liking, affection for another who is very close or closely attached.
the force of habit that forces one do something without thinking.
a continuous, assiduous practice to make a thing used to or accustomed to.
one who practices.
one who studies for acquiring knowledge; a student.
one who examines with a view to knowing the fact or truth.
one who has just commenced his professional practice.
a person who is acquiring a trade, craft or skill; an apprentice.
that which is acquired, gained by practice.
the knowledge gained by studying.
to do or engage in frequently or usually; to make a habit or custom of.
to do repeatedly in order to learn or become proficient.
to apply one's mind to attentively; to try to learn or understand by reading, thinking, etc. to study.
to examine or investigate carefully.
to instruct so as to make proficient or qualified; to train.
to cause to study.
the act of bringing near or towards.
act of robbing; plundering.
that which can be or is, taken as food; meal.
the act of sprinkling over.
the act of consecrating a thing by sprinkling water with hymns being recited.
sprinkled.
that which is sprinkled (said with ref. to water, other liquid etc.).
that on which water, milk or ghee is sprinkled.
to scatter (water, milk, ghee etc.) in drops; to scatter drops upon; to sprinkle.

very sharp - a) violent or impetuous; sudden and forceful; ferocious; b) harsh, biting or severe; c) highly formidable or terrific; d) strong; biting; pungent, as in taste or smell; d) having a point or edge.
prosperous condition; good fortune, wealth, success, etc; prosperity.
the act of rising from a seat as a mark of respect.
the act or process of elevating, uplifting or the state of being raised.
the act, process or fact of - a) moving upward or from a lower to a higher degree ; b) attaining a higher level or rank; c) achieving success, prosperity, etc.
the state of being developed, prosperity.
dignity - a) the quality of being worthy of esteem or honour; worthiness; b) high repute; c) the degree of worth, repute or honour.
name of a type of stanza the meter of which is regulated by the number of syllables, having four groups of three syllables followed by a long syllable in each quarter (uuu, -uu, -uu, -uu, -).
the ritual related to, helping in achieving, one's prosperity( chiefly earthly success).
